line_1: (For where's the perfect Man, who ne'er offends?)
line_2: If otherwise he disoblige his Friends,

line_1: He chides their Care, their Diligence offends.
line_2: Reserv'd and cold to his officious Friends,

line_1: Which way of Living much offends
line_2: The Alderman, who gets and spends,

line_1: Oft she rejects, but never once offends.
line_2: Favours to none, to all she Smiles extends,
